intro: Orthosiphon tomentosus var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered hairy mint, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, four-lobed fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
